channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: Bucksâ€™ Physical Play Makes Celtics Suddenly Look Average. https://t.co/hXysDWjmCF
@Scobleizer i'm not going anywhere either.
@matty8r i had a longer answer here before, but basically -- yes.
@TommyBeer I voted but I hate the Nets.
Three pieces from 1997. https://t.co/Bi6PxDEhnV
11 Time Loop Novels for Fans of Russian Doll. https://t.co/ZSd6Ts1THV
Lyme disease vaccine: the frustrating reason there isnâ€™t one for humans. https://t.co/pLZgGZ2X5Q

@bvschroeder aha -- i'm on high sierra, 10.13.6. i have an up to date mac i can test on here.
@bvschroeder when i test on 11.4, it works properly! ;-) https://t.co/R0bZcvgNRe
@argonaut Yes. I feel that way too. But I have a surprisingly few number of people in that category. And there must be better ways to do that.
It would be a good idea to read up on how Ukraine got rid of their Putin-infested government. We need to do that here in the US and elsewhere in the west.
@matty8r it's not a matter of software, we have the software, it's a matter of finding the right people willing to try who really have a common mission and will put the time into it.
@bvschroeder I think we're getting close. Hey I've really enjoyed this collaboration. Just want to say thanks. ;-)

I don't see why we have anything invested in Twitter continuing to work. What's the benefit? Are we dealing with our planet-scale problems any better that we would without it? Maybe letting it fall apart is the best thing. https://t.co/AgHiKXkNQk
@marshallk there are laws about this btw and they vary from state to state. my company was in calif, where the laws favor the employee.

@marshallk hard to say. i had it happen twice. once with my vp-sales going to our chief competitor who was kicking our ass. it looked terrible, beyond whatever secrets he took with him.
@marshallk also had apple hire away a developer who i assigned to work on a project with apple. made it hard to trust them.
@marshallk Most people don't think so. Happens all the time.
@bvschroeder interesting. so you're saying that it's being transmitted correctly but the browser on the mac is mangling it? i'm using chrome.
@jeremyzilar oh fuck you. :-)
@fxshaw my brain isn't working this morning. the fog is thick. ;-)

Here's the result of getting a tweet containing a Wordle report, when retrieved via the Twitter API. https://t.co/gh2sPrnlZn Note that the text of the tweet appears to be mangled. Trying to figure out how to get this via the API... https://t.co/zyctBh1NM5

@marcedavis Also there was the perfect opportunity to do so, when government officials started posting official documents to @medium. Even the then-president, Obama, did it as did the Speaker of the House. That should not have been allowed.
@marcedavis @Medium Also the Library of Congress started archiving tweets. Ridiculous. Another clear signal that something bigger was called for.

My tweets for April are automatically archived in JSON, in case someday I want to read them into a database and use them in some way. I can leave notes to the future in this manner. Here's the JSON. https://t.co/COmgUrildB
